text: hi guys, i have a question:

what is the best way to test custom modules without having to publish the pages? i tried install to custom module into a local hubl server but this module is connected to hubdb, so i think the local hubl server is not a good option
why not use content staging?
how is that?
how does it work?

Content staging allows you to stage existing pages on your site work on them without affecting the live page, then when you’re ready can overwrite the live page basically.

You can get at it through site pages, in the more tools area or if you have the <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> it’s in the developer menu: <https://spin.d.pr/D2LmWX> (link to the extension)
Does design Certification enabled?
The design certification course is no longer accessible. They are removing it in favor of a new certification they are working on that will be tied to the Developer CMS course
When the CMS certification will be lanuched?

think last I heard they’re shooting for late in Q1 of this year.

That said I would personally estimate probably 4-5 months from now.(not that they have a habit of taking longer or anything, it’s just a ton of work they have to do to create the certification and all of the training materials)
So long time.. okay. Thanks for you answer!
ok Jon, thanks, i'll try this option
no problem. In the meantime if you have a design cert, it will expire at it’s normal expiration date, so it didn’t just dissapear on you if you already had it.
Anyone interested to connect HubSpot chat bot to there stores, for on demand coupon code generation, order status check and much more that an e-commerce store chat bot can have?
I don’t have a client that’s specifically asked for it, but I do have a couple clients that would likely be interested in that sort of thing if you’re trying to gauge interest
that said though, because it’s ecommerce focused it’d have to somehow integrate with shopify or woocommerce + HubSpot
yes <@U7SL518D6>, integration with Woocommerce, magento, prestashop and shopify
the WooCommerce integration is ready for beta trial if anyone interested
Well I’ll ask about it - no idea if they’ll bite or not, if they bite I’ll put you in contact since I don’t know the details of your chatbot thing
in the starting of next week, we will have the demo and landing page ready, thanks <@U7SL518D6>

Question: We are looking to redirect a user to the appropriate subdomain based on their IP address, for something like country recognition? So if I’m in an IP address in Spain I’m redirected to the es. subdomain, I know about Smart Content but how would that work, can I do smart content on Site Settings?
Anyone else here get some DNS notification emails this morning regarding email sending domains? Multiple portals got flagged for us, but I'm reviewing them now and all the records appear correct...

<@UETH1SULA> - Jon's correct. Design Cert was retired in September because it was very outdated and basic.

The new CMS for Developers is well underway. There are already 4 lessons live (with the last 2 going live by the end of this month). View them here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/learning-center/tracks/34>

Once all the content is live, the team will create a new practicum and certification criteria. Then we will officially "launch" the new CMS for Developers certification.

(thanks for the initial reply <@U7SL518D6> :raised_hands:)

I'd estimate end of February / early March for the certification to be available. In the meantime, all the content will be already live and you can get sandbox portals to play in with the Discovery Kit: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/discoverykit>
Yes, received about 15
cc <@U6MHBFW1K>
we don’t send those emails - that’s the email team
email sending domains are in a different system
<@U6GNQ7JBU> if there’s a jira about this feel free to cc me

`{{ request.geoip_country }} `. The data is IP-based and isn’t great though. You could include some code in your header that checks this and spits out a javascript redirect if they should be on a different subdomain
<@U24DCSJBE> That helps - thank you!

Does anyone know how I can get or send a link to a HS contact to their email subscription preferences?  We have contacts who opted out and now wants to opt back in, but not sure how to do that for them?
Maybe you can figure out the url by grabbing the email pref url through an email then finding out their contact id
Oh actually <@U7TAZ6V2Q>  i know how
Preview an email as that user grab the email pref link
Thats it

Was there any update on this? I know we got email and i verified with our team as well. When i went in to "verify" its telling me the CNAME records are incorrect yet its the exact ones they requested to be added...
anyone ever gotten a "failed to move file" when moving things in the File Manager?

Hey Mark, this doc walks through where to find the missing DNS records. If you don't see the missing records flag for the email sending domain section it's all set! <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/how-can-i-resolve-the-missing-records-associated-with-my-email-sending-domain>
<@U2H3TT8F2> The cname records haven't changed for the email sending domain. Feel free to DM me your domain and I can take a look if you're having trouble getting things connected
I think ours is a propagation thing for the moment.  Ill try back to verify in a few hours.

To allow people to opt themselves in in the future, you can enable a resubscription email from your HubSpot Forms here: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email-user-guide-v2/set-up-resubscription-emails-for-forms-and-pop-up-forms>
<@U2H3TT8F2> I hope so, but I'm not so sure; we're dealing with the same issue and all our records are the same between what HubSpot is requesting and what is in our zones.

One common problem is some DNS providers like Network Solutions will automatically add <http://domain.com|domain.com> to the end record. If thats the case adding `hs2._domainkey` instead of `<http://hs2._domainkey.domain.com|hs2._domainkey.domain.com>` as the host should resolve that. But happy to help out if that's not the case & its still not resolving :slightly_smiling_face:
<@UFBQ4K6BV> still no dice for me; tried it both ways. Our DNS provider is bluehost, The only error I get on their side is that I can't add the trailing period in the value field.
Is it available to add Upwork profile?
<@UFBQ4K6BV> our resolved after adding the records, we just needed to wait for propagation.
Thank you both. <@UFBNA9K9A> I didn’t know that function existed! Nice!
<@U22PJPGK0> Thank you this could work well

Does anyone have any recommendations for a way to store what would effectively by “variables” that could be accessed across email templates in workflows, chats, and web pages? My use case is that I have a series of rolling deadlines for classes that we run and right now we end up having to edit those in a bunch of different places. I’m trying to make life easier and be able to update that date in a single place. It seems like Snippets would have been the answer but my sense is that snippets are more “autocomplete” and less “storage variables”. Any help would be extremely appreciated!
Hey <@UDZ9QUU4T> you can do that by storing them in contact properties, which platform are you using to running the online classes?
